meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome in battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was able to debel the fierce dragon and save the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The army worked together to debel the enemy forces and secure victory.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used his powers to debel the villain and save the city.
meanings.sent4: With determination and courage, she was able to debel the challenges that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team managed to debel the reigning champions in a surprising turn of events.

meanings.definition: To bring under control or subdue.
meanings.sent1: The trainer had to debel the wild horse before it could be ridden.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to debel the unruly crowd to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to debel the mischievous rabbit causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: She had to debel her fear of heights in order to climb the tall mountain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher needed to debel the noisy classroom before starting the lesson.

meanings.sent1: The illness debel him, making it hard for him to walk.
meanings.sent2: Lack of exercise can debel your muscles over time.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much junk food can debel your body and make you feel tired.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter weather can debel the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Stress can debel your immune system, making you more susceptible to getting sick.
